revised_title: DNA Methylation and Gene Regulation: The Role of Methylated CpG Binding Protein (MeCP)
tldr: The authors discovered a nuclear protein called Methylated CpG Binding Protein (MeCP) that binds preferentially to methylated DNA. This protein may play a role in the inaccessibility of methylated CpGs in mammalian nuclei, contributing to gene regulation and chromatin structure. MeCP is distinct from previously identified sequence-specific methylated DNA binding proteins.
